column4: Guys, I forgot how to choose what apps load at login. Could I have a quick reminder?
and DaveyJ: Thank you both most kindly!
synaptic, search for linux I believe, install the header package that says it'll always install the latest header package
'locate headers' should give you a clue
any chance the panel itself is crashing?
it usually happens when I switch resolutions.
no, the switching resolution might have a similar effect of what I'm looking for
do you know how I can get those icons back, or even better, to stop them from going away?
do they come back if you kill gnome-panel?
alternatively, do they disappear when you do it?
now only one application is left.
okay;  windows has had the same problem before (things not reappearing in the tray after explorer crashes)
This happens much more often than explorer crashing. I don't want to switch to KDE, but I don't know...
sorry, as I said, I'm just shouting idea's, but gnome-panel itself restarting is probably the culprit;
